眼.definition: eye (CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]); (often used with 一[yi1]) a look; a glance; small hole; (bound form) salient point; classifier for wells, cave-dwellings etc

眼不見為淨.definition: what remains unseen is deemed to be clean; what the eye doesn't see, the heart doesn't grieve over (idiom)

眼不見，心不煩.pinyin: yan3 bu4 jian4 , xin1 bu4 fan2
眼不見，心不煩.definition: what the eye doesn't see, the heart doesn't grieve over (idiom)

眼中刺.definition: a thorn in one's eye; fig. a thorn in one's flesh

眼中釘，肉中刺.pinyin: yan3 zhong1 ding1 , rou4 zhong1 ci4

眼光.definition: gaze; insight; foresight; vision; way of looking at things

眼前.definition: before one's eyes; now; at present

眼前一亮.definition: (one's) eyes light up; to be impressed by what one sees

眼力.definition: eyesight; strength of vision; the ability to make discerning judgments

眼力見.definition: (dialect) ability to read situations and respond appropriately

眼力見兒.definition: erhua variant of 眼力見|眼力见[yan3li4jian4]

眼圈.definition: rim of the eye; eye socket

眼圈紅了.definition: to be on the verge of tears

眼屎.definition: sleep (dried mucus in the corner of the eye)

眼底.definition: fundus of the eye (containing the choroid, retina, optic nerve etc); inside the eye; right in front of one's eyes; in full view as a panorama

眼底下.definition: in front of one's eyes; in full view as a panorama; right now

眼房.definition: camera oculi; aqueous chamber of the eye

眼珠兒.definition: eyeball; fig. the apple of one's eye (i.e. favorite person)

眼珠子.definition: eyeball; fig. the apple of one's eye (i.e. favorite person)

眼界.definition: (lit. and fig.) field of vision; scope; horizon

眼皮子底下.definition: right in front of sb's eyes; right under sb's nose; current; at the moment

眼看.definition: soon; in a moment; to look on as sth happens

眼眵.definition: sleep (dried mucus in the corner of the eye)

眼眶.definition: eye socket; rim of the eye

眼睛吃冰淇淋.pinyin: yan3 jing5 chi1 bing1 qi2 lin2
眼睛吃冰淇淋.definition: (slang) (Tw) to be checking out the hotties

眼睜睜.definition: to stare blankly; to look on helplessly; to look on unfeelingly

眼神.definition: expression or emotion showing in one's eyes; meaningful glance; wink; eyesight (dialect)

眼福.definition: a treat for the eyes; the rare chance of seeing sth beautiful

眼紅.definition: to covet; envious; jealous; green with envy; infuriated; furious

眼紋噪鶥.definition: (bird species of China) spotted laughingthrush (Ianthocincla ocellata)

眼紋黃山雀.definition: (bird species of China) Himalayan black-lored tit (Machlolophus xanthogenys)

眼線.definition: informer; snitch; spy; scout; (cosmetics) eye line

眼罩.definition: eye-patch; blindfold; eye mask; goggles; eyeshade; blinkers (for a horse etc)

眼色.definition: signal made with one's eyes; meaningful glance

眼花.definition: dimmed eyesight; blurred; vague and unclear vision

眼袋.definition: puffiness under the eyes; bags under the eyes

眼裡容不得沙子.pinyin: yan3 li3 rong2 bu5 de2 sha1 zi5
眼裡容不得沙子.definition: can't bear having grit in one's eye (idiom); unable to put sth objectionable out of one's mind; not prepared to turn a blind eye

眼裡揉不得沙子.pinyin: yan3 li3 rou2 bu5 de2 sha1 zi5
眼裡揉不得沙子.definition: see 眼裡容不得沙子|眼里容不得沙子[yan3 li3 rong2 bu5 de2 sha1 zi5]

眼見.definition: to see with one's own eyes; very soon

眼見為實，耳聽為虛.pinyin: yan3 jian4 wei2 shi2 , er3 ting1 wei2 xu1
眼見為實，耳聽為虛.definition: to believe what one sees, not what one hears (idiom). Don't believe what people tell you until you see if for yourself.; It ain't necessarily so.

眼觀六路耳聽八方.pinyin: yan3 guan1 liu4 lu4 er3 ting1 ba1 fang1
眼觀六路耳聽八方.definition: lit. the eyes watch six roads and the ears listen in all directions; to be observant and alert (idiom)

眼觀四處，耳聽八方.pinyin: yan3 guan1 si4 chu4 , er3 ting1 ba1 fang1
眼觀四處，耳聽八方.definition: see 眼觀四面，耳聽八方|眼观四面，耳听八方[yan3 guan1 si4 mian4 , er3 ting1 ba1 fang1]

眼觀四面，耳聽八方.pinyin: yan3 guan1 si4 mian4 , er3 ting1 ba1 fang1
眼觀四面，耳聽八方.definition: lit. the eyes observe all sides and the ears listen in all directions (idiom); fig. to be observant and alert

眼角.definition: outer or inner corner of the eye; canthus

眼露殺氣.definition: to have a murderous look in one's eyes (idiom)

眼饞肚飽.definition: to have eyes bigger than one's belly (idiom)

眼高.definition: haughty; contemptuous; to have high expectations

眼高手低.definition: to have high standards but little ability; to be fastidious but incompetent (idiom)
